billEvents.eventText: REFERRED TO MENTAL HEALTH AND DEVELOPMENTAL DISABILITIES

title: Limits the proximity of community residential facilities for the disabled
summary: Limits the proximity of newly located community residential facilities for the disabled to within a one mile radius of an existing facility.

       AN ACT to amend the mental hygiene law, in relation to limiting the site
         selection for community residences for the disabled

         THE PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND  ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1. Subdivision (b) of section 41.34 of the mental hygiene law,
    2  as  amended  by  chapter 1024 of the laws of 1981, is amended to read as
    3  follows:
    4    (b) If a sponsoring agency intends to establish a residential facility
    5  for the disabled within a municipality but does not have a specific site
    6  selected, it may notify the chief executive officer of the  municipality
    7  in  writing  of its intentions and include in such notice  a description
    8  of the nature, size and community support requirements of  the  program.
    9  [Provided,  however, nothing] NOTHING in this subdivision shall preclude
   10  the proposed establishment of a site pursuant to subdivision (c) of this
   11  section PROVIDED, HOWEVER, THAT NO NEW  RESIDENTIAL  FACILITY  SHALL  BE
   12  SITED OR ESTABLISHED WITHIN A ONE MILE RADIUS OF AN EXISTING FACILITY.
   13    S  2.  This  act shall take effect immediately and shall apply to site
   14  selections made on and after the effective date of this act.

memo:
BILL NUMBER:S2305

TITLE OF BILL:
An act to amend the mental hygiene law, in relation to limiting the site
selection for community residences for the disabled

SUMMARY:
This bill amends section 41.34 of the mental hygiene law, as amended by
chapter 1024 of the laws of 1981 so that if a sponsoring agency intends
to establish a residential facility for the disabled within a munici-
pality and does not have a specific site for this facility, they may
notify the chief executive officer of the municipality in writing. The
sponsoring agency must provide the nature, size and community support
requirements of the program.

However, as an additional provision, this bill holds that no new resi-
dential facility shall be sited or established within a one mile radius
of an existing facility.

JUSTIFICATION:
We are approaching a situation in which oversaturation by residential
facilities for the disabled in certain areas is becoming an issue. In
the past, the coordination of the development and construction of these
residential facilities has been done irresponsibly and inefficiently. It
is the hope that by restricting the proximity within which an organiza-
tion can establish a residential facility for the disabled, we will
avoid the dilemma which oversaturation has often created.

FISCAL IMPLICATION:
To be determined.

EFFECTIVE DATE:
This act shall take effect immediately and shall apply to site
selections made on and after the effective date of this act.
